column5: Well since it was such a nice day yesterday a buddy of mine and I decided to see what we could see at the harbour. Almost all of the ice is out and we were good to go. About 5 minutes in a hit, fish on, set the hook...I guess I forgot to reset my drag after the winter, fish off.  We spent a couple hours down there and had a few follows on very typical slow presentation baits so i decided to go the oposite way and let a spinner sink and then burn it back.About 3 casts in my Mepps black fury was crushed by the fatest pike I have ever seen. Probably only 32 inches but 12-15lbs. 3 casts later I had a day ending birds nest with the new power pro.  All in all it was a great first day out and the pike are pretty active already.
sounds like a fun day out on the water
Good job i cant wait to get  out and fish the soft water.
Thats great stuff.  This year I'm definitely gonna head down and try the harbour pike action, I keep here great stories like yours.
good stuff.  Nice to see people getting out fishing before they close the season down there.  Sounds like that pike may have eaten a bowling ball, quite heavy for the length.
I'll be down there tomorrow.  If you don't hear from me, I didn't catch anything.
Nice job! The only lure that has caught me more TO pike then the Black Fury is the Aglia.
Nice report, good to hear the toothy critters are around.
good job. I love those black furys and aglias.
Thanks for the report. We will probably see a couple of more T.O pike reports before the season closes Mar. 31st. There are some big ones there in March like the one in my avatar.  cheers,  ehg
